Sentencas: In the spraying process, residual stresses are unavoidably developed in coatings due to the differences in thermal expansion coefficients, and cooling conditions between the coating and the substrate.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A significant residual stress may lead to micro-cracks in the film or cause the film to peel off the substrate.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, in this work, the biaxial residual stress states of a SOFC anode with various spraying conditions by using the sin(2)psi technique of the XRD method were studied.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results show that the NiO/LDC coating on the porous Ni substrate with high temperature displayed the lowest compressive residual stress.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The compressive residual stress in the NiO/LDC anode decreases with the increase of the Ni substrate temperature during the plasma spraying.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, the coating thickness didn't show the obvious effect on the residual stress.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Moreover, the compressive stress will promote the tendency of coatings to debond or curve all the cell components.
Titulo: Residual stresses in the atmospheric plasma sprayed NiO/LDC anode of the metallic supported solid oxide fuel cells
